meanings.definition: Of or relating to a noun.
meanings.sent1: The denominal word 'happy' describes a feeling.
meanings.sent2: In English class, we learned about denominal words like 'beautiful'.
meanings.sent3: The denominal book cover caught my eye with its colorful design.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a denominal ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The denominal concept of 'freedom' is important in our society.

meanings.sent1: She will denominalize the adjective 'strong' into a noun.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to denominal the word 'run' into a noun.
meanings.sent3: I denominalized the word 'jump' to create a new noun for our game.
meanings.sent4: His creativity allows him to denominalize any word effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: We can denominalize 'fast' to form the noun 'speed'.

meanings.definition: To remove the nominal value from something.
meanings.sent1: The clearance sale will denominal the prices of all items.
meanings.sent2: The discount will denominal the cost of the product.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally denominaled the gift by revealing its price.
meanings.sent4: The magic trick seemed to denominal the value of the coin.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected sale denominaled the worth of the antique vase.
